extension.name: k2fields contents
extension.author: $Author$
extension.description: K2/k2fields contents presentation based on various powerful slideshows with ability to partition along category and authors. Will include other options in near future.

field.name: item
field.label: Specific items
field.description: Higher presedence over category selection

field.name: items
field.label: Drag and drop to re-order items

field.name: stickto
field.label: Sticky on
field.description:
Menu - items found within categories assigned anywhere in your main menu. Particularly useful for a website that is mainly based on K2 and want to present items from each of those.
Category - items with the same category as the current category or item page. If current page doesn't relate to K2 then nothing is shown.
Item - present various parts of the same item currently showing. If current page is not an item page then nothing is shown.
Item tag/keyword/field is used to feature items that have the same value of tag, keyword or field as the current category or item page. In case of field you should choose in the [Stick to fields] option which fields values to match on. Not choosing [Stick to fields] might lead to decreased responsiveness. If current page is not an item page then nothing is shown.

field.label: Fetch items from children categories

field.name: getChildrenExclude

field.description: Immediate children selects immediate children of chosen top most category

field.name: sticktofields
field.label: Stick to fields (Applies only if sticky criteria is set to field)
field.query: SELECT sall.value, sall.sticktofields FROM (SELECT f.id as value, c.id as catid, f.ordering, concat(trim(substring(f.name, 1, instr(f.name, ' / '))), ' (', c.name, ')') as sticktofields FROM #__k2_extra_fields f INNER JOIN #__k2_extra_fields_groups g ON f.`group` = g.id INNER JOIN #__k2_categories c ON c.extraFieldsGroup = g.id WHERE f.published = 1 AND c.published = 1 AND f.name NOT LIKE '%TYPE:complex%' AND f.name NOT LIKE '%TYPE:alias%' union all SELECT CONCAT(ali.id, '.', SUBSTRING(al, 1, IF(LOCATE(':::', al) = 0, LOCATE('---', al), LOCATE(':::', al))-1)) as value, ali.catid, ali.ordering, ali.sticktofields FROM (SELECT SUBSTRING(d.definition, LOCATE('alias=', d.definition)+6) AS al, f.id, c.id as catid, f.ordering, concat(trim(substring(f.name, 1, instr(f.name, ' / '))), ' (', c.name, ')') as sticktofields FROM #__k2_extra_fields f INNER JOIN #__k2_extra_fields_definition d ON f.id = d.id INNER JOIN #__k2_extra_fields_groups g ON f.`group` = g.id INNER JOIN #__k2_categories c ON c.extraFieldsGroup = g.id WHERE f.published = 1 AND c.published = 1 AND f.name NOT LIKE '%TYPE:complex%' AND f.name LIKE '%TYPE:alias%') as ali union all SELECT CONCAT(sf.id, ',', sf.subofId) as value, c.id as catid, sf.subofOrdering, concat(trim(substring(sf.name, 1, instr(sf.name, ' / '))), ' (Subfield of ', trim(substring(sf.subofName, 1, instr(sf.subofName, ' in '))), ', ',c.name, ')') as sticktofields FROM (select f.*, fd.id as subofId, fd.name as subofName, fd.`group` as subofGroup, fd.published as subofPublished, fd.ordering as subofOrdering FROM #__k2_extra_fields f, #__k2_extra_fields_definition d, #__k2_extra_fields fd WHERE d.definition LIKE CONCAT('%subfields=%', f.id, '%') AND d.id = fd.id) as sf INNER JOIN #__k2_extra_fields_groups g ON sf.subofGroup = g.id INNER JOIN #__k2_categories c ON c.extraFieldsGroup = g.id WHERE sf.published = 1 AND sf.subofPublished = 1 AND c.published = 1) as sall ORDER BY sall.catid, sall.ordering

field.description: If you get additional themes please do save them in there own folders in media/mod_k2fields_contents/galleria/themes and reload to see them here as option

field.name: galleria_carousel
field.label: carousel
field.description: Setting this to true, the carousel will be automatically applied if the total som of thumbnails width exceeds the thumbnail container. This will be re-calculaed on resize.

field.name: galleria_carouselFollow
field.label: carouselFollow
field.description: This option defines if the the carousel should follow the active image. You can control the speed of the animation with the carouselSpeed option. Please note that animating heavy thumbnails can affect your main image animation, so if you are seeing big lags in the main animation you can try to set this option to false.

field.name: galleria_carouselSteps
field.label: carouselSteps
field.description: (a number or auto = will move the carousel as many steps as there are visible thumbnails) The number of steps the carousel will advance when navigating between available thumbnails. You can control the animation speed using the carouselSpeed option.

field.name: galleria_clicknext
field.label: clicknext
field.description: This options adds a click event over the stage that navigates to the next image in the gallery. Useful for mobile browsers and other simpler applications. Note that setting this to true will disable any other links that you might have in the data object.

field.name: galleria_dataConfig
field.label: dataConfig (tbi)
field.description: This very useful function configures how the data should be extracted from the source. It should return an object that will blend in with the default extractions.

field.name: galleria_dataSelector
field.label: dataSelector
field.description: The selector Galleria should look for in the HTML source. If you are using other elements than images to store data in the HTML, you can set this option to configure Galleria to look for the right elements. You can use any jQuery selector.

field.name: galleria_dummy
field.label: dummy
field.description: This option allows you to define an image that should be shown if Galleria can not find the original image. Think of it as a 404 for Galleria.

field.name: galleria_easing
field.label: easing
field.description: If you use any easing other than those prefixed with galleria please make sure to include the jQuery easing plugin found in the advanced section.

field.name: galleria_fullscreenCrop
field.label: fullscreenCrop
field.description: Sets how Galleria should crop when in fullscreen mode.
field.option: true (all images will be scaled to fill the stage, centered and cropped)
false (will scale down so the entire image fits)
height (will scale the image to fill the height of the stage)
width (will scale the image to fill the width of the stage)
landscape (will fill up images that has landscape proportions, but scale portrait images to fit inside the container)
portrait (is like landscape but the other way around)

field.name: galleria_fullscreenDoubleTap
field.label: fullscreenDoubleTap
field.description: This options listens for the double-tap event on touch devices and toggle fullscreen mode if it happens.

field.name: galleria_fullscreenTransition
field.label: fullscreenTransition
field.description: Defines a different transition for fullscreen mode. Some transitions are less smooth in fullscreen mode, this option allows you to set a different transition when in fullscreen mode.

field.name: galleria_height
field.label: height
field.description: Unless you have specific requirements this is implicitly set by k2fields as we set the height of the container to the module height. Galleria need a height to work properly. You can set the height using this option to make sure it has the correct height. If no height is set, Galleria will try to find the height of the parent container. You can set an exact value, f.ex 200, and it will apply this exact height in pixels. You can also set a relative ratio value which is anything below 2. If you set a relative ratio value, the gallery height will be calculated by multiplying this value with the width at any given scaling process. This is very useful when programming responsive layouts.

field.name: galleria_idleMode
field.label: idleMode
field.description: Global option for turning on/off idle mode. Eache gallery enters idle mode after certain amount of time and themes behave differently when this happens, f.ex clears the stage from distractions. If you want to prevent idle mode from ever occuring, set this to false.

field.name: galleria_idleSpeed
field.label: idleSpeed (milliseconds)
field.description: animation speed of the idle elements

field.name: galleria_imageCrop
field.label: imageCrop
field.description: Defines how the main image will be cropped inside its container.
field.option: true (all images will be scaled to fill the stage, centered and cropped)
false (will scale down so the entire image fits)
height (will scale the image to fill the height of the stage)
width (will scale the image to fill the width of the stage)
landscape (will fill up images that has landscape proportions, but scale portrait images to fit inside the container)
portrait (is like landscape but the other way around)

field.name: galleria_imageMargin
field.label: imageMargin (pixels)
field.description: Since images are scaled to fit the stage container, there might be occations when you need to apply a margin between the image and stage border.

field.name: galleria_imagePan
field.label: imagePan
field.description: Galleri comes with a built-in panning effect. The effect is sometimes useful if you have cropped images and want to let the users pan across the stage to see the entire image. Set imagePan to true to apply a mouse-controlled movement of the image to reveal the cropped parts. This effect is useful if you want to avoid dark areas around the image but still be able to view the entire image.

field.name: galleria_imagePanSmoothness
field.label: imagePanSmoothness
field.description: This value sets how smooth the image pan movement should be when setting image_pan to true. The higher value, the smoother effect but also CPU consuming.

field.name: galleria_imagePosition
field.label: imagePosition
field.description: Positions the main image inside the stage container. Works like the CSS background-position property, f.ex top right or 20% 100%. You can use keywords, percents or pixels. The first value is the horizontal position and the second is the vertical.

field.name: galleria_imageTimeout
field.label: imageTimeout (milliseconds)
field.description: This option defines how long Galleria will try to fetch the images (unless it returns 404) before an exception is thrown.

field.name: galleria_initialTransition
field.label: initialTransition
field.description: Defines a different transition to show on the first image. F.ex, if you are using a slide transition, you might want the first image to fade. You can then set this option to fade.

field.name: galleria_keepSource
field.label: keepSource
field.description: By default, Galleria clears the source container when rendering the gallery. Sometimes you need to apply the gallery some place else, like a lightbox, but still want to keep the thumbnails in the source. This option sets if the source HTML should be left intact. Setting this to true will also add click events inside the source code, to make your thumbnails clickable. Useful for building custom thumbnails and still have galleria control the gallery.

field.name: galleria_layerFollow
field.label: layerFollow
field.description: Layer follows the image size on the stage, even if crop is set. This means that the HTML layer will stretch according to the active image. If you want the layer to fill the stage regardless of cropping settings, set this to false.

field.name: galleria_lightbox
field.label: lightbox
field.description: This option acts as a helper for attaching a lightbox when the user clicks on an image. If you have a link defined for the image, the link will take precedence.

field.name: galleria_lightboxFadeSpeed
field.label: lightboxFadeSpeed (milliseconds)
field.description: The lightbox will animate and fade the images and captions. This value controls how fast they should fade.

field.name: galleria_lightboxTransitionSpeed
field.label: lightboxTransitionSpeed (milliseconds)
field.description: The lightbox will animate the white square before displaying the image. This value controls how fast it should animate.

field.name: galleria_maxScaleRatio
field.label: maxScaleRatio
field.description: Sets the maximum scale ratio for images. F.ex, if you do not want Galleria to upscale any images, set this to 1. Leave this empty to allow any scaling of the images.

field.name: galleria_minScaleRatio
field.label: minScaleRatio
field.description: Sets the minimum scale ratio for images. F.ex, if you do not want Galleria to downscale any images, set this to 1. Leave this empty to allow any scaling of the images.

field.name: galleria_overlayBackground
field.label: overlayBackground
field.description: Overlay background color in lightbox.

field.name: galleria_overlayOpacity
field.label: overlayOpacity
field.description: Overlay opacity in lightbox.

field.name: galleria_pauseOnInteraction
field.label: pauseOnInteraction
field.description: During playback, Galleria will stop the playback if the user presses thumbnails or any other navigational links. If you dont want this behaviour, set this option to false.

field.name: galleria_popupLinks
field.label: popupLinks
field.description: Setting this to true will open any image links in a new window.

field.name: galleria_preload
field.label: preload
field.description:
Defines how many images Galleria should preload in advance. Please note that this only applies when you are using separate thumbnail files. Galleria always cache all preloaded images.
2 preloads the next 2 images in line
all forces Galleria to start preloading all images. This may slow down client.
0 will not preload any images

field.name: galleria_queue
field.label: queue
field.description: Galleria queues all activation clicks: next, prev and thumbnails. You can see this effect when f.ex clicking next fast many times. If you do not want Galleria to queue, set this to false. This will make Galleria stall during animations.

field.name: galleria_responsive
field.label: responsive
field.description: This option sets thew Gallery in responsive mode. That means that it will resize the entire container if your CSS is dynamic. In other words, you can add media queries or dynamic proportions in your CSS and the gallery will follow these proportions as the window resizes.

field.name: galleria_show
field.label: show
field.description: This defines what image index to show at first. If you use the history plugin, a permalink will override this number.

field.name: galleria_showInfo
field.label: showInfo
field.description: display the caption

field.name: galleria_showImagenav
field.label: showImagenav
field.description: display the image navigation, next and prev arrows

field.name: galleria_swipe
field.label: swipe
field.description: Enables a swipe movement for flicking through images on touch devices.

field.name: galleria_thumbCrop
field.label: thumbCrop
field.description: Defines how the thumb image will be cropped.
field.option: true (all images will be scaled to fill the stage, centered and cropped)
false (will scale down so the entire image fits)
height (will scale the image to fill the height of the stage)
width (will scale the image to fill the width of the stage)
landscape (will fill up images that has landscape proportions, but scale portrait images to fit inside the container)
portrait (is like landscape but the other way around)

field.name: galleria_thumbFit
field.label: thumbFit
field.description: If this is set to true, all thumbnail containers will be shrinked to fit the actual thumbnail size. This is useful if you have thumbnails of various sizes and will then float nicely side-by-side. This is only relevant if thumbCrop is set to anything else but true. If you want all thumbnails to fit inside a container with predefined width and height, set this to false.

field.name: galleria_thumbMargin
field.label: thumbMargin (pixels)
field.description: Since thumbs are scaled to fit there container, there might be occasions when you need to apply a margin between the thumbnail and container border.

field.name: galleria_thumbnails
field.label: thumbnails
field.option: Empty spans with the className img

field.name: galleria_thumbQuality
field.label: thumbQuality
field.description: Defines if and how IE should use bicubic image rendering for thumbnails.
field.option: will force high quality renedring (can slow down performance)
will not use high quality (better performance)
uses high quality if image scaling is moderate

field.name: galleria_touchTransition
field.label: touchTransition
field.description: Defines a different transition when a touch device is detected.

field.name: galleria_transition
field.label: transition
field.description: The transition that is used when displaying the images.

field.name: galleria_transitionSpeed
field.label: transitionSpeed (milliseconds)
field.description: Time between applying transition. The higher number, the slower transition.

field.name: galleria_trueFullscreen
field.label: trueFullscreen
field.description: Galleria supports true fullscreen mode if it is supported by the browser (currently FF10+, Safari 5.1+ and Chrome 15+). That means that it will enter a native OS fullscreen if the fullscreen method is triggered.

field.name: galleria_wait
field.label: wait (milliseconds)
field.description: Sets how long Galleria should wait when trying to extract measurements, before throwing an error. Set this to true for infinity. When Galleria initializes, it needs to be able to take measures of the layout. Setting width and height is not enough, it also need to be able to extract computed values, and that can only be done if the gallery is visible. This can be a problem if you are running galleries in a javascript accordion or pagination, where you hide some parts of the content. Then Galleria will fail to load on all hidden pages. This little option allows you to define how long Galleria will try to extract these measurements. Default is 5 seconds, but you can also set this to true and let the Gallery wait for an infinity, or until the gallery is shown by user interaction. As soon as the Gallery can grab the right measurements, it will appear.

field.name: galleria_width
field.label: height
field.description: Unless you have specific requirements this is implicitly set by k2fields as we set the width of the container to the module width.

field.name: galleria_debug
field.label: debug
field.description: Galleria displays errors by printing them out in the gallery container and sometimes throw exceptions. For deployment you can turn debug off to generate a more generic error message if a fatal error is raised.

field.name: easyslider_pause

field.name: camera_portrait

field.description: Select true if you don't want that your images are cropped

field.name: camera_slideOn
field.label: slideOn
field.description: decide if the transition effect will be applied to the current (prev) or the next slide
